alert.note: Alert for Onondaga; Schuyler; Seneca; Southern Cayuga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 1:42PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Seneca, northwestern Schuyler, eastern Yates, northwestern Cayuga, northwestern Onondaga and central Steuben Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 142 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oswego to near Montezuma to Bluff Point to near Greenwood. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Lysander, Baldwinsville, Seneca Falls, Bath, Waterloo, Penn Yan, Romulus, Fayette and Sennett. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 36 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central New York.
